body.p: The following examples show how to read fixed-width data.

section.title: Example 1 – Loading a table with all fields defined

p.codeblock: CREATE READABLE EXTERNAL TABLE students ( name varchar(20), address varchar(30), age int) LOCATION ('file://<host>/file/path/') FORMAT 'CUSTOM' (formatter=fixedwidth_in, name=20, address=30, age=4);

section.title: Example 2 – Loading a table with PRESERVED_BLANKS on

p.codeblock: CREATE READABLE EXTERNAL TABLE students ( name varchar(20), address varchar(30), age int) LOCATION ('gpfdist://<host>:<portNum>/file/path/') FORMAT 'CUSTOM' (formatter=fixedwidth_in, name=20, address=30, age=4, preserve_blanks='on',null='NULL');

section.title: Example 3 – Loading data with no line delimiter

p.codeblock: CREATE READABLE EXTERNAL TABLE students ( name varchar(20), address varchar(30), age int) LOCATION ('file://<host>/file/path/') FORMAT 'CUSTOM' (formatter=fixedwidth_in, name='20', address='30', age='4', line_delim='?@')

section.title: Example 4 – Create a writable external table with a \r\n line delimiter

p.codeblock: CREATE WRITABLE EXTERNAL TABLE students_out ( name varchar(20), address varchar(30), age int) LOCATION ('gpfdist://<host>:<portNum>/file/path/students_out.txt') FORMAT 'CUSTOM' (formatter=fixedwidth_out, name=20, address=30, age=4, line_delim=E'\r\n');
